criteria: Ability to Differentiate Between Safe and Unsafe Touches
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of personal boundaries.
Struggles to identify personal boundaries in simple scenarios.
Can identify personal boundaries in some familiar scenarios but not consistently.
Consistently identifies personal boundaries in most scenarios.
Clearly and accurately identifies personal boundaries in various complex scenarios.
Demonstrates a nuanced understanding of personal boundaries and can apply this understanding to complex and unfamiliar situations, demonstrating empathy and respect for others' boundaries.
Cannot differentiate between safe and unsafe touches.
Struggles to differentiate between safe and unsafe touches, even with guidance.
Can differentiate between safe and unsafe touches in simple, clear-cut scenarios.
Consistently differentiates between safe and unsafe touches in most common scenarios.
Clearly and accurately differentiates between safe and unsafe touches in a variety of scenarios, including those with ambiguous cues.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of safe and unsafe touches, including the context and intention behind them. Can articulate these distinctions clearly and respectfully.
Is unaware of any reporting mechanisms for inappropriate touching.
Knows of one reporting mechanism but cannot describe it accurately.
Can name one or two reporting mechanisms but is unsure of the process.
Knows and can accurately describe at least two reporting mechanisms.
Knows multiple reporting mechanisms and can explain the steps involved in reporting.
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of reporting mechanisms and can advocate for others to use them, showing an understanding of the importance of seeking help.
